10.text:
So you just got your EE TV box? Its super
simple to get yourself setup.

14.text:
You should have received one of these in the
mail.

17.text:
Inside there’s everything you need to start
- your EE TV box and power unit

21.text:
and your ethernet, aerial and HDMI cables.
and of course, your remote control and batteries.

27.text:
Plus this handy aerial adaptor.
You’ll also find this

31.text:
quick start guide. It summarises everything
so you can refer back to it in your own time.

36.text:
Before we get started, there’s two things
to check.

39.text:
First, make sure you have EE Broadband connected
and that it’s working. Your brightbox router

48.text:
And secondly, you’ll need a working TV aerial
on your rooftop and a nearby

52.text:
aerial socket. It’ll look something like
this and will probably have an aerial cable

56.text:
connecting it to your TV or existing set-top
box.

61.text:
If you need more help with your aerial, visit
the EE website to find out more before you

65.text:
start installation.
First up, are you replacing an existing set-top

74.text:
box with your new EE TV box?
If so, you need to disconnect it from your

79.text:
TV. As you do, keep an eye out for the aerial
cable.

82.text:
Its easy to spot-it’ll be the cable that
goes from your existing box to the aerial

86.text:
socket on the wall.
and it’ll look very similar to this.

90.text:
Unplug the aerial Cable from the existing
set-top box and plug it in here, to the socket

95.text:
marked ‘IN’.
If the cable doesn’t fit the socket, you

99.text:
can use the adaptor that’s included in the
startup box to make it fit. You can also use

104.text:
the adapter to extend an existing cable if
you need.

108.text:
If you’re not replacing an existing box,
you’ll find your aerial cable is probably

111.text:
connected directly from the wall to the television.
Disconnect it from the TV and similarly plug

117.text:
it into the EE TV box to the socket marked
IN.

125.text:
Next up, we’ll connect the EE TV box to
the telly. Take a look at the back of your

130.text:
TV and see if you’ve got an HDMI socket
on the back.

134.text:
Most TVs made in the last few years have one
of these. It should be clearly marked HDMI.

139.text:
Take the HDMI cable that came with your EE
TV box

142.text:
and connect one end
to the back of your TV like this. It should

146.text:
just fit straight in so long as you’ve got
it the right way around. If your TV has more

150.text:
than one HDMI socket then make a note of which
number HDMI as it will help identify it later

156.text:
Take the other end and connect it to the HDMI
socket here.

160.text:
If your tv doesn’t have an HDMI socket,
you’ll need this special EE TV SCART Cable.

166.text:
To get one, call us on this number below and
we’ll post it out free of charge.

174.text:
Now we need to get EE TV online. If your Bright
Box router is near the TV, as it is here,

179.text:
you’ll probably want to connect it with
the ethernet cable we’ve included in your

183.text:
pack. Plug one end
in here on your EE TV box and the other end

188.text:
into your router here.
If you’d rather connect the box via wifi,

192.text:
you can do that once it’s on and connected.
You can also connect via Powerline Adaptors

197.text:
if your wifi signal doesn’t reach all around
your home. Watch our separate video to find

202.text:
out more about how to do this.
Next we need to pop the batteries into the

211.text:
remote control…
and connect your EE TV to the power. Take

215.text:
the power unit
and connect this end here.

219.text:
Make sure the power is off at the wall,
and plug in. Don’t forget to turn the power

223.text:
back on!
You’ll now see your EE TV box come to life

228.text:
and the light on the front will flash. Once
it turns to solid green, you’re ready to

233.text:
move on.
It’s time to turn your TV on.

240.text:
If you don’t see the EE TV screen straight
away, you’ll need to find it on your TV.

245.text:
To do that, take your television remote and
press the source button. It might also be

250.text:
labelled AV or INPUT or look like this
depending on your TV make and model.

257.text:
Wait a couple of seconds. If you don’t see
the EE screen, press the button again. You

262.text:
may have to press the button several times
until you’ve found the number of the socket

265.text:
you used and noted earlier to connect your
EE TV Box to your telly.

270.text:
That’s it. It’s all easy from here. Just
follow the on screen instructions to finish

274.text:
setting up. If you’re having problems or
are unsure about any of the steps, check the

278.text:
Quick Start Guide included in the pack.
To find out more, visit the EE website.
